{{cpp/filesystem/title|is_fifo}}
{{cpp/filesystem/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|filesystem}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=c++17|1=
bool is_fifo( std::filesystem::file_status s ) noexcept;
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++17|1=
bool is_fifo( const std::filesystem::path&amp; p );
}}
{{dcl|num=3|since=c++17|1=
bool is_fifo( const std::filesystem::path&amp; p, std::error_code&amp; ec ) noexcept;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Checks if the given file status or path corresponds to a FIFO or pipe file as if determined by POSIX [https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/basedefs/sys_stat.h.html {{c|S_ISFIFO}}].

@1@ Equivalent to {{c|1=s.type() == file_type::fifo}}.

@2,3@ Equivalent to {{c|is_fifo(status(p))}} or {{c|is_fifo(status(p, ec))}} respectively.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|s|file status to check}}
{{par|p|path to query}}
{{par|ec|error code to modify in case of errors}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{c|true}} if the file indicated by {{c|p}} or if the type indicated {{c|s}} refers to a FIFO pipe, {{c|false}} otherwise. The non-throwing overload returns {{c|false}} if an error occurs.

===Exceptions===
{{cpp/filesystem/error_handling|p|throw=/2,3}}
